page.title: 13PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: { {Headlam Hall}was a manor house built in the 18th century showing Jacobean and 18th century work. It was converted in 1981 to a hotel and restaurant. It is the only amenity in the village and is quite imposing. {Gainford Hall}is now a working farm. It is a fine example of a Jacobean mansion and reflects all the important points of its period. It was famous for breeding pedigree bulls. In the garden there is a 17th century dovecote with a 'beehive' domed roof. {Barforth Hall}today is a working farm. It was a manor house built in the Elizabethan period. Today it is used as a house by the owners of the farm Mr. and Mrs. Reeves. It has been painted white with black window frames.
